Articles.Content: Help fulfill the contract. I flew to the moon. He took with him a thermometer. Measure the temperature. Landed back on Krebin. But the contract was not counted. What would it do to fulfill this contract ??? In the contract the following points are indicated: 1) Transport experiment to Mun 2) Satisfy all experiment (check experiment for details) 3) Complete experiment 4) Landbin or splash completed experiment on Kerbin.

Hello @Vadym.

Usually temperature experiments need to be done in a specific location. If you go to the Mun in the tracking station and double click it you should be able to see some thermometer icons. That is where you need to measure the temperature.
And where is this station located ??? I went to the tracking center, but there are no icons there.
Sorry I meant tracking center. Double click on the mun (this will focus your view on the Mun) and then you should see the icons.
I thought so too. But there are no icons. And even in the description of the contract is not required to measure in a particular place.
Are you sure you clicked to keep the temp reading before returning?
What is the exact wording of the contract? I've not seen a contract worded as you described. Do you have Contract Configurator installed?

Configurator not. I hear about him for the first time. I accurately kept the thermometer readings. I kept both the empty value and the value when there were glasses of science. Prilitev on the moon, the first paragraph, which says that you need to deliver an experiment on the moon, was counted, and the rest did not.
Could you take a screen shot of the contract window, in Mission Control? Upload it to Imgur.com or any other site that allows linking, and we'll be able to help you much better.
Here are the links https://imgur.com/jQ5n9v9       https://imgur.com/l1ukG9l

9 hours ago, Vadym said:

Here are the links https://imgur.com/jQ5n9v9       https://imgur.com/l1ukG9l

That looks like you're running some contract-related mod; I don't think that's a stock contract.

In which case, you'd need someone familiar with that mod to help you. I'd suggest asking about it in the mod's release thread.
